V Furlaniji tudi letos sedem restavracij ohranilo prestižno priznanje
07 Nov 2019, 13:21 by Spletno uredništvo

Gostilna Pri Lovcu, ki jo na Subidi pri Krminu vodi družina Joška Sirka, se bo še naprej ponašala z Michelinovo zvezdico. Prestižno priznanje so potrdili včeraj v Piacenzi na predstavitvi novega kulinaričnega vodnika za leto 2020. Na Goriškem je poleg Sirka zvezdico obdržala restavracija L’Argine, ki jo je leta 2014 v Venkovem pri Dolenjah odprla tržaška kuharska mojstrica Antonia Klugmann, poroča Primorski dnevnik.



Joško Sirk Foto: Veronika Rupnik Ženko

PIACENZA > Največ restavracij s tovrstnim priznanjem v Furlaniji - Julijski krajini je na Videmskem, kjer se z eno Michelinovo zvezdico ponašajo Osteria Altran iz Rude, La Taverna iz kraja Colloredo di Monte Albano in Al Ferarùt iz Rivignana. Restavracija Agli Amici iz kraja Godia pri Vidmu pa je edina v deželi, ki ima dve zvezdici. Skupno je v Italiji 35 restavracij z dvema zvezdicama, enajst pa jih ima po tri zvezdice, potem ko se je eliti včeraj pridružil lokal Enrica Bartolinija v muzeju Mudec v Milanu. V Trstu ima eno Michelinovo zvezdico restavracija Harry’s Piccolo, medtem ko na Pordenonskem ostajajo brez priznanja kulinaričnega vodnika, še dodaja Primorski dnevnik.

In Friuli, seven restaurants have maintained a prestigious recognition this year
07 Nov 2019, 13:21 by Web Editing

Pri Lovcu Tavern, run by Josko Sirko's family at Subida pri Krmin, will continue to boast a Michelin star. The prestigious recognition was confirmed yesterday in Piacenza at the presentation of a new culinary guide for 2020. In Gorizia, in addition to Sirko, the star was retained by L'Argine restaurant, which was opened in 2014 by Venetian chef Antonia Klugmann in Venkov, reports Primorski dnevnik.



Josko Sirk Photo: Veronika Rupnik Female

PIACENZA> Most restaurants with this type of recognition in Friuli-Venezia Giulia are in Udine, with one Michelin star boasting Osteria Altran of Rude, La Taverna of Colloredo di Monte Albano and Al Ferarùt of Rivignano. The Agli Amici restaurant from Godia near Udine is the only one in the country that has two stars. In total, there are 35 two-star restaurants in Italy, eleven of which have three stars, after the elite joined the Enrico Bartolini restaurant at the Mudec Museum in Milan yesterday. Harry's Piccolo Restaurant has one Michelin star in Trieste, while the Pordenone restaurant remains unrecognized as a culinary guide, the Primorski Dnevnik added.
